articles.author: Channy Yun (윤석찬)
articles.description: Amazon S3 Express One Zone announces significant price reductions, including reducing pricing for storage by 31%, PUTs by 55%, and GETS by 85%. In addition, S3 Express One Zone has reduced its per-gigabyte data upload and retrieval charges by 60% and now applies these charges to all bytes rather than just portions of requests exceeding 512 kilobytes.
articles.title: Announcing up to 85% price reductions for Amazon S3 Express One Zone

articles.author: Sébastien Stormacq
articles.description: Mistral AI's multimodal model, Pixtral Large 25.02, is now available in Amazon Bedrock as a fully managed, serverless offering with cross-Region inference support, multilingual capabilities, and a 128K context window that can process images alongside text.
articles.title: AWS announces Pixtral Large 25.02 model in Amazon Bedrock serverless

articles.author: Danilo Poccia
articles.description: Amazon Nova Sonic is a new foundation model on Amazon Bedrock that streamlines speech-enabled applications by offering unified speech recognition and generation capabilities, enabling natural conversations with contextual understanding while eliminating the need for multiple fragmented models.
articles.title: Introducing Amazon Nova Sonic: Human-like voice conversations for generative AI applications

articles.author: Esra Kayabali
articles.description: Amazon Bedrock Guardrails introduces enhanced capabilities to help enterprises implement responsible AI at scale, including multimodal toxicity detection, PII protection, IAM policy enforcement, selective policy application, and policy analysis features that customers like Grab, Remitly, and KONE are leveraging to standardize safeguards across generative AI applications.
articles.title: Amazon Bedrock Guardrails enhances generative AI application safety with new capabilities

articles.author: Elizabeth Fuentes
articles.description: Amazon Nova Reel 1.1 enables the generation of multi-shot videos up to 2-minutes in length and style consistency across shots, and quality and latency improvements over Amazon Nova Reel 1.0.
articles.title: Amazon Nova Reel 1.1: Featuring up to 2-minutes multi-shot videos

articles.author: Sébastien Stormacq
articles.description: AWS Summit season starts this week! These free events are now rolling out worldwide, bringing our cloud computing community together to connect, collaborate, and learn. Whether you prefer joining us online or in-person, these gatherings offer valuable opportunities to expand your AWS knowledge. I will be attending the Summit in Paris this week, the biggest […]
articles.title: AWS Weekly Review: Amazon EKS, Amazon OpenSearch, Amazon API Gateway, and more (April 7, 2025)

articles.author: Sanhawat Taongern
articles.description: In this post, we share how UNiDAYS achieved AWS Region expansion in just 3 weeks using AWS services.
articles.title: How UNiDAYS achieved AWS Region expansion in 3 weeks

sources.title: The latest from GitHub's engineering team - The GitHub Blog

articles.author: Brian Beach
articles.description: Earlier today Amazon Q Developer launched inline chat in the Eclipse IDE (in preview). In this post, I’ll walk you through how I’ve been using this powerful new capability to streamline my Java development workflow, from refactoring existing code to optimizing performance-critical methods. Whether you’re a seasoned Eclipse veteran or just getting started, you’ll see […]
articles.title: Announcing inline chat in Eclipse with Amazon Q Developer

articles.author: Brian Beach
articles.description: As the world of software development becomes increasingly global, the need for tools that support multiple languages has become paramount. Earlier today, Amazon Q Developer announced expanded language support. In this post, I explore the recent expansion of language support in Amazon Q Developer, a powerful platform used by developers worldwide to discuss architecture, create documentation, […]
articles.title: Speaking Your Language: Expanded language support in Amazon Q Developer

articles.author: Dinesh Prabakaran
articles.description: In today’s rapidly evolving software landscape, maintaining and modernizing Java applications is a critical challenge for many organizations. As new Java versions are released and best practices evolve, the need for efficient code transformation becomes increasingly important. Amazon Q Developer transformation for Java using the Command Line Interface (CLI) presents a powerful alternative to integrated […]
articles.title: Using the Amazon Q Developer command line transformation tool

articles.author: Svenja Raether
articles.description: Today we’re announcing the general availability (GA) of the Amazon EventBridge Scheduler and Targets Level 2 (L2) constructs in the AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK) construct library. EventBridge Scheduler is a serverless scheduler that enables users to schedule tasks and events at scale. Prior to the launch of these L2 constructs, developers had to […]
articles.title: Announcing the General Availability of the Amazon EventBridge Scheduler L2 Construct

articles.author: Suruchi Saxena
articles.description: As organizations modernize their database infrastructure, migrating from systems like Oracle to open source solutions such as PostgreSQL is becoming increasingly common. However, this transition presents a significant challenge: discovering and converting embedded SQL within existing Java applications to ensure compatibility with the new database system. Manual conversion of this code is time-consuming, error-prone, and […]
articles.title: Converting embedded SQL in Java applications with Amazon Q Developer

articles.author: Matt Laver
articles.description: For software developers, development teams and IT Professionals, the Amazon Q Developer Pro Tier is recommended. The pro tier offers higher limits, enterprise administration, an analytics dashboard, code customizations and IP indemnity. In addition, the Amazon Q Developer Pro Tier requires AWS IAM Identity Center. For most production deployments, an organization instances of IAM Identity […]
articles.title: Introducing the quick start experience for Amazon Q Developer Pro

articles.author: Nick Corbishley
articles.description: “Are they just playing insane or are they actually insane?” Amid all the economic chaos and fallout triggered by Trump’s tariffs barrage and with markets continuing to slide even after Trump’s announcement of a 90-day pause on tariffs on everyone but China, one could be forgiven for failing to hear the faintest but growing sounds […]

articles.description: We re-architected Super Slurper from the ground up using our Developer Platform — leveraging Cloudflare Workers, Durable Objects, and Queues — and improved transfer speeds by up to 5x.
articles.title: Making Super Slurper 5x faster with Workers, Durable Objects, and Queues

articles.author: Phillip Jones
articles.description: R2 Data Catalog is now in public beta: a managed Apache Iceberg data catalog built directly into your R2 bucket.
articles.title: R2 Data Catalog: Managed Apache Iceberg tables with zero egress fees

articles.author: Justin Mazzola Paluska
articles.description: D1, Cloudflare’s managed SQL database, announces read replication beta. Here's a deep dive of the read replication implementation and how your queries can remain consistent across all regions.
articles.title: Sequential consistency without borders: how D1 implements global read replication

articles.author: Micah Wylde
articles.description: We’ve just shipped our new streaming ingestion service, Pipelines — and we’ve acquired Arroyo, enabling us to bring new SQL-based, stateful transformations to Pipelines and R2.
articles.title: Just landed: streaming ingestion on Cloudflare with Arroyo and Pipelines

articles.author: Zaid Farooqui
articles.description: Announcing Cloudflare Realtime and RealtimeKit, a complete toolkit for shipping real-time audio and video apps in days with SDKs for Kotlin, React Native, Swift, JavaScript, and Flutter.
articles.title: Make your apps truly interactive with Cloudflare Realtime and RealtimeKit

articles.author: Mia Malden
articles.description: Securely store, manage and deploy account level secrets to Cloudflare Workers through Cloudflare Secrets Store, available in beta – with role-based access control, audit logging and Wrangler support.
articles.title: Introducing Cloudflare Secrets Store (Beta): secure your secrets, simplify your workflow

articles.author: Nikita Cano
articles.description: Cloudflare Snippets are now generally available, enabling fast, cost-free JavaScript-based HTTP traffic modifications across all paid plans.
articles.title: Cloudflare Snippets are now Generally Available

articles.author: Emily Music
articles.description: Cloudflare has been tracking and comparing our speed with other top networks since 2021. Let’s take a look at how things have changed since our last update.
articles.title: Network performance update: Developer Week 2025

articles.author: Rohin Lohe
articles.description: We’ve improved Observability for Workers by announcing the General Availability of Workers Logs and the introduction of the Query Builder to help you investigate log events across all of your Workers.
articles.title: Introducing Workers Observability: logs, metrics, and queries – all in one place

articles.author: Korinne Alpers
articles.description: You can now deploy static sites and full-stack applications on Cloudflare Workers. Framework support for React Router v7, Astro, Vue and more are generally available today and Cloudflare Vite plugin.
articles.title: Your frontend, backend, and database — now in one Cloudflare Worker

articles.author: Dario Piotrowicz
articles.description: With the 1.0-beta release of the Cloudflare adapter for OpenNext, you can host your Next.js 14 and 15 applications on Cloudflare Workers.
articles.title: Deploy your Next.js app to Cloudflare Workers with the Cloudflare adapter for OpenNext

articles.author: Andrew Repp
articles.description: Hyperdrive, Cloudflare's global connection pooler, relies on some key innovations to make your database connections work. Let's dive deeper, in celebration of its availability for Free Plan customers.
articles.title: Pools across the sea: how Hyperdrive speeds up access to databases and why we’re making it free

articles.author: Thomas Gauvin
articles.description: MySQL comes to Cloudflare Workers and Hyperdrive: MySQL drivers and ORMs are now compatible with Workers runtime, and Hyperdrive allow you to connect to your regional database from Workers.
articles.title: Build global MySQL apps using Cloudflare Workers and Hyperdrive

articles.author: James Opstad
articles.description: The Cloudflare Vite plugin integrates Vite, one of the most popular build tools for web development, with Workers runtime. Today, we announce the 1.0 release and official support for React Router v7.
articles.title: "Just use Vite”… with the Workers runtime

articles.author: Nevi Shah
articles.description: You can now add a Deploy to Cloudflare button to your repository’s README when building a Workers application, making it simple for other developers to set up and deploy your project!
articles.title: Skip the setup: deploy a Workers application in seconds

articles.author: Brandon Strittmatter
articles.description: Cloudflare has acquired Outerbase, expanding our database and agent developer experience capabilities.
articles.title: Cloudflare acquires Outerbase to expand database and agent developer experience capabilities

articles.author: Sid Chatterjee
articles.description: Workflows — a durable execution engine built directly on top of Workers — is now Generally Available. We’ve landed new human-in-the-loop capabilities, more scale, and more metrics.
articles.title: Cloudflare Workflows is now GA: production-ready durable execution

articles.author: Anni Wang
articles.description: AutoRAG is here: fully managed Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines powered by Cloudflare's global network and powerful developer ecosystem.
articles.title: Introducing AutoRAG: fully managed Retrieval-Augmented Generation on Cloudflare

articles.author: Rita Kozlov
articles.description: Cloudflare delivers toolkit for AI agents with new Agents SDK support for MCP (Model Context Protocol) clients, authentication/authorization/hibernation for MCP servers and Durable Objects free tier.
articles.title: Piecing together the Agent puzzle: MCP, authentication & authorization, and Durable Objects free tier
